body:
Comment 10: 
After thinking about this some more, I think the current situation is fine. Handlers
that care can set a content type, and as far as I can tell the default behaviour (no
Content-Type header sent in response to HEAD requests) does not cause problems for any
known HTTP client.

If someone wants this reopened I would suggest noting a practical problem with the
current behaviour (e.g. a particular HTTP client that misbehaves because of this) along
with a proposed solution.
_Status changed to **WorkingAsIntended**._
